Mansfield Rule.definition: a rule that a juror's affidavit or testimony as to juror misconduct during deliberations may not be used to impeach the verdict
Mansfield Rule.origin: [after William Murray, first Earl of Mansfield (1705-1793), British jurist who set forth the rule]

1.1: a rule that a juror's affidavit or testimony as to juror misconduct during deliberations may not be used to impeach the verdict
